courses.name: CRJ 478 Introduction to Philosophy
courses.description: Introduction to Philosophy and Ethics explore fundamental questions about existence.

courses.description: An in-depth study of the major theoretical issues in criminology.

courses.name: CRJ 436 Capstone Research Project
courses.description: Students work in groups to plan, design, and carry out a research project.

courses.name: CRJ 332  Criminal Justice System
courses.description: The course covers both substantive and procedural law related to the definitions.

courses.name: CRJ 398 Impact of Technology
courses.description: Examines how technology influences society industries, ethics, and human interactions.

courses.name: CRJ 459 Social Research Methods
courses.description: An overview of the scientific approach to the study of social phenomena through quantitative.

courses.name: CRJS 30 Level Elective
courses.description: Explores the intersection of criminal justice and sociology,

courses.name: CRJ 239 Interpreting the Past
